utterance.speaker: PHOEBE
utterance.content: Ooh, ooh, ooh, ooh, ooh. Ugly Naked Guy is decorating his tree. Oh my God, you should see the size of his Christmas Balls.

utterance.speaker: JOEY
utterance.content: Hey.

utterance.speaker: CHANDLER
utterance.content: Hey.

utterance.speaker: RACHEL
utterance.content: Hey.

utterance.speaker: JOEY
utterance.content: Hey, how much did you guys tip the super this year?

utterance.speaker: CHANDLER
utterance.content: Yeah, we were gonna give fifty, but if you guys gave more, we don't wanna look bad.

utterance.speaker: MONICA
utterance.content: Oh, actually this year we just made him homemade cookies.

utterance.speaker: CHANDLER
utterance.content: And twenty-five it is.

utterance.speaker: JOEY
utterance.content: You gave him cookies?

utterance.speaker: MONICA
utterance.content: Money is so impersonal. Cookies says someone really cares. . . Alright, we're broke, but cookies do say that.

utterance.speaker: PHOEBE
utterance.content: I can see that. A plate of brownies once told me a limerick.

utterance.speaker: CHANDLER
utterance.content: Phoebs, let me ask you something, were, were these, uh, funny brownies?

utterance.speaker: PHOEBE
utterance.content: Not especially. But you know what, I think they had pot in them.

utterance.speaker: ROSS
utterance.content: So you guys, who else did you tip with cookies?

utterance.speaker: RACHEL
utterance.content: Uhh, the mailman, the super.

utterance.speaker: MONICA
utterance.content: Oh, and the newspaper delivery guy.

utterance.speaker: JOEY
utterance.content: Oh my God.

utterance.speaker: RACHEL
utterance.content: What?

utterance.speaker: JOEY
utterance.content: Uhhh, I don't think you're gonna like this.

utterance.speaker: RACHEL
utterance.content: Ooh, goooosh, ooh, these are cookies smashed in the sports section.

utterance.speaker: MONICA
utterance.content: Oh look, and he did my crossword puzzle.

utterance.speaker: ROSS
utterance.content: Yeah, but not very well, unless 14-across, 'Gershwin musical' actually is bitemebitemebitemebiteme.

utterance.speaker: JOEY
utterance.content: I can't believe it's Christmas already. Ya know, I mean, one day your eatin' turkey, the next thing ya know, your lords are a-leapin' and you geese are a-layin'.

utterance.speaker: CHANDLER
utterance.content: Which is why geese are so relaxed this time of year.

utterance.speaker: ROSS
utterance.content: Hey guys.

utterance.speaker: JOEY
utterance.content: Hey.

utterance.speaker: ROSS
utterance.content: Hey Rach. I, uh, got you a little present. . . I'll open it. It's a Slinky! Remember, huh. Walks down stairs, alone or in pairs, everyone knows it's. . . just a big spring. Alright, you still mad at me becuase of the whole. . .

utterance.speaker: RACHEL
utterance.content: Horrible and degrading list of reasons not to be with me?

utterance.speaker: ROSS
utterance.content: How 'bout from now on we just call it the 'unfortunate incident'? Hey Gunther, you got stairs in your place?

utterance.speaker: GUNTHER
utterance.content: Yeah.

utterance.speaker: ROSS
utterance.content: Here, go nuts.

utterance.speaker: ROSS
utterance.content: Hey guys.

utterance.speaker: JOEY
utterance.content: Hey.

utterance.speaker: CHANDLER
utterance.content: What's in the bag?

utterance.speaker: ROSS
utterance.content: Um, just some presents.

utterance.speaker: JOEY
utterance.content: C'mon show us what you bought. . . You know you want to.

utterance.speaker: ROSS
utterance.content: OK. OK, this is a picture frame from Ben to my parents, huh.

utterance.speaker: MONICA
utterance.content: Cute.

utterance.speaker: ROSS
utterance.content: I got some, uh, hers and hers towels for Susan and Carol. And, uh, I got this blouse for mom.

utterance.speaker: MONICA
utterance.content: Ross, that is gorgeous!

utterance.speaker: ROSS
utterance.content: Yeah?

utterance.speaker: MONICA
utterance.content: Look at these authentic fake medals. I tell ya, mom's gonna be voted best dressed at the make-believe military academy.

utterance.speaker: PHOEBE
utterance.content: Hey.

utterance.speaker: GANG
utterance.content: Hey. Hi Phoebe.

utterance.speaker: PHOEBE
utterance.content: Happy Christmas Eve Eve. Oh my God, where did you get this?

utterance.speaker: ROSS
utterance.content: Uh, Macy's, third floor, home furnishings.

utterance.speaker: PHOEBE
utterance.content: This is my father, this is a picture of my dad.

utterance.speaker: CHANDLER
utterance.content: Nah, Phoebs, that's the guy that comes in the frame.

utterance.speaker: PHOEBE
utterance.content: No it isn't, this is my dad, alright, I'll show you.

utterance.speaker: RACHEL
utterance.content: Phoebe, I thought your dad was in prison.

utterance.speaker: PHOEBE
utterance.content: No, that's my stepdad. My real dad's the one that ran out on us before I was born.

utterance.speaker: RACHEL
utterance.content: How have you never been on Oprah?

utterance.speaker: PHOEBE
utterance.content: OK, look, see, this is him. My mother gave me this picture before she died, same guy.

utterance.speaker: MONICA
utterance.content: Honey, uh, this is a picture of the frame guy posing in front of a bright blue screen with a collie.

utterance.speaker: PHOEBE
utterance.content: It's not a blue screen... it's just, maybe it was just really clear that day. OK, I have to talk to my grandmother.

utterance.speaker: MONICA
utterance.content: Oh, wait a minute honey.

utterance.speaker: GANG
utterance.content: Phoebs.

utterance.speaker: MONICA
utterance.content: Wow.

utterance.speaker: JOEY
utterance.content: So anyway, I'm trying to get my boss's ex-wife to sleep with me. . .

utterance.speaker: GANG
utterance.content: Joey!

utterance.speaker: JOEY
utterance.content: Oh, but when Phoebe has a problem, everyone's all ears!

utterance.speaker: GRANDMOTHER
utterance.content: Esther Livingston. Gone.

utterance.speaker: GRANDMOTHER
utterance.content: Hi, Phoe.

utterance.speaker: PHOEBE
utterance.content: Hi Gram. Whatcha doin'?

utterance.speaker: GRANDMOTHER
utterance.content: Oh, just updating the phonebook.

utterance.speaker: PHOEBE
utterance.content: Um, gram, um, can I see the pictures of my dad again?

utterance.speaker: GRANDMOTHER
utterance.content: Oh. Oh, sure, sure, uh, uh, how come?

utterance.speaker: PHOEBE
utterance.content: Just, you know, to see... um.

utterance.speaker: GRANDMOTHER
utterance.content: Oh, sure, yeah. This is the one of you father in a meadow, and, uh, helping a little boy fly a kite, and here he is at a graduation. . . another graduation. . . another graduation.

utterance.speaker: PHOEBE
utterance.content: OK, is this really my father?

utterance.speaker: GRANDMOTHER
utterance.content: Is it really your fa--I can't... well of course it is.

utterance.speaker: PHOEBE
utterance.content: OK, I smell smoke. Maybe that's 'cause someone's pants are on fire.

utterance.speaker: GRANDMOTHER
utterance.content: Look, I. . .

utterance.speaker: PHOEBE
utterance.content: Ya know, in all the years that we have been grandmother and granddaughter, you have never lied to me.

utterance.speaker: GRANDMOTHER
utterance.content: Alright, that is not your father, that's just a picture of a guy in a frame.

utterance.speaker: PHOEBE
utterance.content: Oh God.

utterance.speaker: GRANDMOTHER
utterance.content: It was your mother's idea. Ya know, she didn't want you to know your real father because it hurt her so much when he left, and, I didn't want to go along with it, but, well then she died and, and it was harder to argue with her. Not impossible, but harder.

utterance.speaker: PHOEBE
utterance.content: Alright, so, what, he's not a famous tree surgeon? And then, I guess, OK, he doesn't live in a hut in Burma where there's no phones?

utterance.speaker: GRANDMOTHER
utterance.content: Last I heard, he was a pharmacist somewhere upstate.

utterance.speaker: PHOEBE
utterance.content: OK, that makes no sense. Why would the villagers worship a pharmacist?

utterance.speaker: GRANDMOTHER
utterance.content: Honey.

utterance.speaker: PHOEBE
utterance.content: Oh.

utterance.speaker: GRANDMOTHER
utterance.content: Anyway, that's all I know. That, and this. This is the real him.

utterance.speaker: PHOEBE
utterance.content: Oh.

utterance.speaker: CHANDLER
utterance.content: Ya know I remember my father, all dressed up in the red suit, the big black boots, and the patent leather belt, sneakin around downstairs. He didn't want anybody to see him but he'd be drunk so he'd stumble, crash into something and wake everybody up.

utterance.speaker: RACHEL
utterance.content: Well, that doesn't sound like a very merry Christmas.

utterance.speaker: CHANDLER
utterance.content: Who said anything about Christmas?

utterance.speaker: MONICA
utterance.content: Hi.

utterance.speaker: ROSS
utterance.content: Hey, anyone hear from Phoebe yet?

utterance.speaker: RACHEL
utterance.content: No, nothin'.

utterance.speaker: MONICA
utterance.content: I hope she's OK.

utterance.speaker: JOEY
utterance.content: Yeah, I know exactly what she's goin' through.

utterance.speaker: MONICA
utterance.content: How do you know exactly what she's going through?

utterance.speaker: JOEY
utterance.content: She told us.

utterance.speaker: CHANDLER
utterance.content: So whaddya got there Monica?

utterance.speaker: MONICA
utterance.content: Just some stuff for the party.

utterance.speaker: ROSS
utterance.content: Yeah, what're you guys doin' here, aren't you supposed to be Christmas shopping?

utterance.speaker: MONICA
utterance.content: You guys haven't gotten your presents yet? Tomorrow's Christmas Eve, what're ya gonna do?

utterance.speaker: CHANDLER
utterance.content: Don't you have to be Claymation to say stuff like that?

utterance.speaker: RACHEL
utterance.content: Oh, by the way Mon, I don't think the mailman liked your cookies. Here are the ornaments your mom sent.

utterance.speaker: MONICA
utterance.content: Well, maybe the mailman liked the cookies, we just didn't give him enough.

utterance.speaker: JOEY
utterance.content: Monica, pigeons learn faster that you.

utterance.speaker: ROSS
utterance.content: Hey, Rach, you know what? I think, I think I know what'll make you feel better. How 'bout you make a list about me.

utterance.speaker: RACHEL
utterance.content: Wha... forget it Ross, no, I am not gonna stand here and make a list of. . .

utterance.speaker: ROSS
utterance.content: C'mon Rachel.

utterance.speaker: RACHEL
utterance.content: OK, you're whiney, you are, you're obsessive, you are insecure, you're, you're gutless, you know, you don't ever, you don't just sort of seize the day, you know. You like me for what, a year, you didn't do anything about it. And, uh, oh, you wear too much of that gel in your hair.

utterance.speaker: ROSS
utterance.content: See there, you uhh, alright, ya, you did what I said.

utterance.speaker: RACHEL
utterance.content: Yeah, and you know what? You're right, I do feel better, thank you Ross.

utterance.speaker: PHOEBE
utterance.content: Yeah, um, in Albany, can I have the number of Frank Buffay. . . OK, um, in Ithica. . . alright, um, Saratoga. . . Oneonta. Alright, you know what, you shouldn't call youself information.

utterance.speaker: GRANDMOTHER
utterance.content: Hey.

utterance.speaker: PHOEBE
utterance.content: Hello grandma, if that is in fact your real name.

utterance.speaker: GRANDMOTHER
utterance.content: C'mon now Phoe, don't still be mad at me. How's it going?

utterance.speaker: PHOEBE
utterance.content: Well, not so good. Upstate's pretty big, he's pretty small, you do the math.

utterance.speaker: GRANDMOTHER
utterance.content: Well, I think you're better off without him. Oh honey, I know he's your daddy but, but to me he's still the irresponsible creep who knocked up your mom and stole her Gremlin.

utterance.speaker: PHOEBE
utterance.content: No I just, just wanted to know who he was, ya know.

utterance.speaker: GRANDMOTHER
utterance.content: I know. OK, I wasn't completely honest with you when I told you that, uh, I didn't know exactly where he lived.

utterance.speaker: PHOEBE
utterance.content: Whattaya mean?

utterance.speaker: GRANDMOTHER
utterance.content: He lives at 74 Laurel Drive in Middletown. If you hit the Dairy Queen, you've gone too far. You can take my cab.

utterance.speaker: PHOEBE
utterance.content: Wow. Thank you.

utterance.speaker: GRANDMOTHER
utterance.content: Now, remember, nobody else drives that cab.

utterance.speaker: PHOEBE
utterance.content: Uh-huh, got it. Ooh, I'm gonna see my dad. Wish me luck, Grandpa!

utterance.speaker: JOEY
utterance.content: Phoebe here with the cab yet?

utterance.speaker: CHANDLER
utterance.content: Yeah, she, she brought the invisible cab. . . hop in.

utterance.speaker: JOEY
utterance.content: Well she better get here soon, the outlet stores close at 7.

utterance.speaker: CHANDLER
utterance.content: Hey, don't worry. I figure it'll be 2 hours to Phoebe's dad's house, they'll meet, they'll chat, they'll swap life stories, we'll still have plenty of time.

utterance.speaker: JOEY
utterance.content: Hey, here she comes.

utterance.speaker: CHANDLER
utterance.content: Hey.

utterance.speaker: JOEY
utterance.content: Hey.

utterance.speaker: PHOEBE
utterance.content: Hey.

utterance.speaker: JOEY
utterance.content: Hey.

utterance.speaker: PHOEBE
utterance.content: Can you believe this. In, like, two hours I'm gonna have a dad. Eeeshk.

utterance.speaker: CHANDLER
utterance.content: Eeeshk.

utterance.speaker: JOEY
utterance.content: Yeah, big stuff.

utterance.speaker: PHOEBE
utterance.content: OK, let's go.

utterance.speaker: CHANDLER
utterance.content: OK.

utterance.speaker: PHOEBE
utterance.content: Alright, here, you have to hold this.

utterance.speaker: CHANDLER
utterance.content: OK. Brake left, gas right?

utterance.speaker: PHOEBE
utterance.content: Uh-huh, yeah, that's my cheat sheet.

utterance.speaker: CHANDLER
utterance.content: Where's my seat belt?

utterance.speaker: PHOEBE
utterance.content: Oh, no no, that side doesn't have one, the paramedics had to cut through it.

utterance.speaker: CHANDLER
utterance.content: Hey!

utterance.speaker: JOEY
utterance.content: Hey.

utterance.speaker: ROSS
utterance.content: C'mon, just tell me, please, please.

utterance.speaker: MONICA
utterance.content: For the sixteenth time, no... I do not think you're obsessive.

utterance.speaker: RACHEL
utterance.content: Oh, gosh, it's hot in here.

utterance.speaker: MONICA
utterance.content: Rach, get the heat. Ross, could you turn the heat down please?

utterance.speaker: ROSS
utterance.content: Sure. By the way, there's a difference between being obsessive and. . .

utterance.speaker: MONICA
utterance.content: Ross, the heat!

utterance.speaker: ROSS
utterance.content: Fine, OK! Heat, heat, heat, and I'm the obsessive one. OK, this way is on, so this is. . . off.

utterance.speaker: RACHEL
utterance.content: Did you just break the radiator?

utterance.speaker: ROSS
utterance.content: No, no, I was turnin' the knob and, and. . . here it is.

utterance.speaker: MONICA
utterance.content: Well put it back.

utterance.speaker: ROSS
utterance.content: It uhh, it won't go back.

utterance.speaker: RACHEL
utterance.content: I'll call the super.

utterance.speaker: MONICA
utterance.content: Here, let me try.

utterance.speaker: ROSS
utterance.content: Oh, oh that's right, I forgot about your ability to fuse metal.

utterance.speaker: MONICA
utterance.content: Hey, it's Funny's cousin, Not Funny.

utterance.speaker: RACHEL
utterance.content: Hi, Mr. Treeger. Hi, it's Rachel Green from upstairs. Yes, somebody, uh, broke our knob on the radiator and it's really hot in here. Yes, it's, it's hot enough to bake cookies. Well, do you think we could have a new one by 6? Wha t, no, no, Tuesday, we can't wait until Tuesday, we're having a party tonight.

utterance.speaker: ROSS
utterance.content: OK, tip the man.

utterance.speaker: MONICA
utterance.content: No, if he doesn't like our cookies, too bad, I am not gonna be blackmailed. Look if worse comes to worse, it gets a little warm, we'll call it a theme party.

utterance.speaker: ROSS
utterance.content: Hey, here's a theme: Come on in, live like bacon.

utterance.speaker: PHOEBE
utterance.content: Ooh, this is it, 74.

utterance.speaker: CHANDLER
utterance.content: Oh, so that's what this is for.

utterance.speaker: PHOEBE
utterance.content: Wow, this is it, I'm gonna meet my dad. This is like the biggest thing ever, huh.

utterance.speaker: CHANDLER
utterance.content: Yeah.

utterance.speaker: JOEY
utterance.content: Sure is.

utterance.speaker: PHOEBE
utterance.content: OK, here I go. I'm goin' in.

utterance.speaker: CHANDLER
utterance.content: Alright.

utterance.speaker: JOEY
utterance.content: Good luck Phoebs.

utterance.speaker: PHOEBE
utterance.content: OK, here I go. . . here I go. . . I'm goin'.

utterance.speaker: RACHEL
utterance.content: Hi, welcome to our tropical Christmas party. You can put your coats and sweaters and pants and shirts in the bedroom.

utterance.speaker: ROSS
utterance.content: It's hard to tell because I'm sweating, but I use exactly what the gel bottle says, an amount about the size of a pea. How, how can that be too much?

utterance.speaker: MONICA
utterance.content: Ice, ice, ice squares anyone? Take a napkin. Alright.

utterance.speaker: ROSS
utterance.content: Monica, Monica, your guest are turning into jerky, OK.

utterance.speaker: MONICA
utterance.content: Really? I'm perfectly comfortable. Hey, hey, hey, get in line buddy, I was next.

utterance.speaker: RACHEL
utterance.content: Mr. Treeger.

utterance.speaker: MR. TREEGER
utterance.content: Uhh, you said there was a party.

utterance.speaker: RACHEL
utterance.content: Oh, yeah, well hey, welcome to our sauna.

utterance.speaker: MR. TREEGER
utterance.content: Ahh, is it hot? My body always stays cool, probably 'cause I have so much skin. Hey, cheese!

utterance.speaker: ROSS
utterance.content: Alright, alright, here's the chance. Monica give him cash, Rachel give him your earrings. Something, now, anything.

utterance.speaker: MONICA
utterance.content: No, I will not cave.

utterance.speaker: RACHEL
utterance.content: Yeah, I'm with Mon.

utterance.speaker: ROSS
utterance.content: Alright, alright, you know how you say I never seize the day? Well, alright, even though he's your super, I'm seizing. Mr. Treeger, here is 50 bucks, merry Christmas.

utterance.speaker: MR. TREEGER
utterance.content: Oh wow, I didn't get you anything. Here's five back.

utterance.speaker: ROSS
utterance.content: No no, no, that, that's your Christmas tip, alright. Oh, hey, do you think there's a chance you could fix that radiator now?

utterance.speaker: MR. TREEGER
utterance.content: No can do, like I told the girl, I can't get a new knob until Thursday.

utterance.speaker: MONICA
utterance.content: Ross.

utterance.speaker: ROSS
utterance.content: Yeah.

utterance.speaker: MONICA
utterance.content: Looks like he's playin' baseball.

utterance.speaker: ROSS
utterance.content: You mean hardball?

utterance.speaker: MONICA
utterance.content: Whatever.

utterance.speaker: RACHEL
utterance.content: What'cha gonna' do?

utterance.speaker: ROSS
utterance.content: Excuse me, I'm seizing. Mr. Treeger, here's another 50, happy Hanukkah. Will uh, will this help with the knob getting?

utterance.speaker: MR. TREEGER
utterance.content: No, the place is not open 'till Tuesday. Am I not saying it right.

utterance.speaker: MONICA
utterance.content: So, wait, you really did like my cookies?

utterance.speaker: MR. TREEGER
utterance.content: Oh, yeah, they were so personal, really showed you cared.

utterance.speaker: RACHEL
utterance.content: Nice seizing. . . gel boy.

utterance.speaker: MR. TREEGER
utterance.content: So, uh, is this, uh, mistletoe?

utterance.speaker: RACHEL
utterance.content: Huh-huh, no act--no, uhh, that, that is basil.

utterance.speaker: MR. TREEGER
utterance.content: Ahh, if it was mistletoe, I was gonna kiss ya.

utterance.speaker: RACHEL
utterance.content: Huh-hoo, yeah, no, it's still basil.

utterance.speaker: PHOEBE
utterance.content: OK.

utterance.speaker: JOEY
utterance.content: How far'd ya get?

utterance.speaker: PHOEBE
utterance.content: Mailbox.

utterance.speaker: CHANDLER
utterance.content: Alright, we're gettin' closer.

utterance.speaker: PHOEBE
utterance.content: Uh-huh.

utterance.speaker: JOEY
utterance.content: Phoebs, what's goin' on?

utterance.speaker: PHOEBE
utterance.content: No, it's just like, ya know, it's a whole mess of stuff, ya know. It's like, yesterday, ya know, my dad was this, like, famous Burma tree surgeon guy and, ya know, now he's a, a pharmacist guy and. . .

utterance.speaker: JOEY
utterance.content: Well, maybe he's, maybe he's this really cool pharmacist guy.

utterance.speaker: PHOEBE
utterance.content: Yeah, maybe, yeah. You know, and, and I'll knock on the door and, and he'll hug me and I'll have a dad. Ya know and I'll, I'll go to his pharmacy and everyone will be really nice to me 'cause, you know, I'm Franks daughter.

utterance.speaker: CHANDLER
utterance.content: Well, so why not go knock?

utterance.speaker: PHOEBE
utterance.content: Well, 'cause, I mean, what if, what if he's not this great dad guy? I mean, what if, what if he's just still the dirtbag who ran out on my mom and us? You know what? I've already lost a fake dad this week and I don't think I'm ready to lose a real one.

utterance.speaker: JOEY
utterance.content: Phoebs, that's OK. You took a big step today.

utterance.speaker: PHOEBE
utterance.content: Yeah?

utterance.speaker: CHANDLER
utterance.content: Yeah, and someday when you're ready, you'll make it past the hedges.

utterance.speaker: JOEY
utterance.content: Yeah, and when you do, he'll be lucky to have you.

utterance.speaker: PHOEBE
utterance.content: You guys. I'm sorry about your shopping.

utterance.speaker: CHANDLER
utterance.content: Oh, that's OK, we'll figure something out.

utterance.speaker: JOEY
utterance.content: Uh, listen Phoebs, I know you're not goin' in there but do you think it'd be alright if I went in and used his bathroom? Oh, that's fine, never mind. Cool, snow, kinda like a blank canvas.

utterance.speaker: CHANDLER
utterance.content: Ho, ho, ho, holy crap is it hot in here!

utterance.speaker: JOEY
utterance.content: Really, hey, you mind if I turn the heat down?

utterance.speaker: MONICA
utterance.content: Hey, we could have used that kind of thinkin' earlier.

utterance.speaker: ROSS
utterance.content: Hey, Phoebs, how'd it go.

utterance.speaker: PHOEBE
utterance.content: Oh, I couldn't go in.

utterance.speaker: MONICA
utterance.content: Honey, I'm sorry.

utterance.speaker: ROSS
utterance.content: Are you OK?

utterance.speaker: PHOEBE
utterance.content: Yeah, yeah, no it's OK 'cause, I mean, I know he's there, so, that's enough for now.

utterance.speaker: CHANDLER
utterance.content: Hey, guys, it's after midnight, merry Christmas everyone.

utterance.speaker: JOEY
utterance.content: Hey, Monica, the knob was broken so I just turned it off from underneath, I hope that's alright.

utterance.speaker: JOEY
utterance.content: Rach, these are for you.

utterance.speaker: RACHEL
utterance.content: Wiper blades. I don't even have a car.

utterance.speaker: JOEY
utterance.content: No, but with this new car smell, you'll think you do.

utterance.speaker: CHANDLER
utterance.content: OK, Phoebs, your turn.

utterance.speaker: PHOEBE
utterance.content: Ahh, toilet seat covers! Is that what you were doing while I was getting gas?

utterance.speaker: JOEY
utterance.content: Uh-huh.

utterance.speaker: PHOEBE
utterance.content: You guuuyys.

utterance.speaker: JOEY
utterance.content: And for Ross, Mr. Sweet-tooth.

utterance.speaker: ROSS
utterance.content: You got me a cola drink?

utterance.speaker: CHANDLER
utterance.content: And, a lemon lime.

utterance.speaker: ROSS
utterance.content: Well this, this is too much, I feel like I should get you another sweater.

utterance.speaker: CHANDLER
utterance.content: And last but not least.

utterance.speaker: JOEY
utterance.content: They're ribbed for your pleasure.
